intro: Strobilanthes lamiifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaf strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its blooming period occurs during the rainy season, and it is known for its ornamental value in horticulture. Strobilanthes lamiifolia is also of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and ecological adaptations.
